intro: Crucianella gilanica subsp. carduchorum, commonly known as the Gilan crucianella, is a flowering plant species native to parts of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and evergreen leaves, often growing in rocky or forested areas. It is typically found in moist, well-drained soils and exhibits a shrub-like growth habit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species in its native range.
